children.name: can be used in various ways
versatile
children.definition: can be used in many different ways: linh hoạt, đa năng
examples: Few foods are as versatile as cheese.
Because lavender oil is versatile and cheap, it is the most used in aromatherapy.
versatility[ uncountable ] :
Hegley’s outstanding versatility as an all-round entertainer

children.name: a versatile work table
examples: The potato is an extremely versatile vegetable.

children.name: multi-purpose
children.definition: able to be used for many different purposes : nhiều công dụng
examples: The emergency box contains a multi-purpose knife with screwdriver, scissors and a can-opener.
The new multi-purpose bank card gives access to your checking accounts and can also be used as a credit card.
a multipurpose building
a multipurpose tool

children.name: all-purpose
children.definition: an all-purpose product has been specially made for all the uses which that type of product has: vạn năng
examples: You can buy an all-purpose greetings card, with blank space, for you to write in your own message.
an all-purpose cleaning fluid
an all-purpose cleaner

children.name: useful
children.definition: helping you to do or get what you wantOPP useless:
examples: useful information
A little Japanese can be really useful.
useful for
Scotch tape is very useful for making quick repairs.
The space under the desk is useful for storing CDs.
useful in
This equipment will prove useful in testing premature babies who we suspect might have hearing problems.
useful to
techniques that could be useful to teachers

children.name: useful information/advice
examples: She gave me some useful advice.

children.name: a useful tip
examples: Their website has some useful tips on selling your home.

children.name: a useful way of doing something
examples: Keeping lists of the words you learn is a useful way of remembering vocabulary.

children.name: a useful tool
examples: The Internet is a useful tool for investors.

children.name: a useful contribution
examples: He played well and made a useful contribution to the team’s performance.

children.name: find something useful
examples: Did you find the book useful?

children.name: prove usefulformal
children.definition: be useful
examples: This equipment could prove useful in testing babies’ hearing.

children.name: it is useful to do something
examples: It is useful to practise in front of an audience.

children.name: come in useful
children.definition: be useful
examples: The extra income would come in useful.

children.name: make yourself useful
children.definition: be helpful
examples: Don’t just stand there – make yourself useful!

children.name: serve a useful purpose/function
children.definition: be useful
examples: Sending her to prison would serve no useful purpose.

children.name: handy
children.definition: informal useful – used especially about something that is convenient and easy to use: hữu ích
examples: This handy booklet tells you everything you need to know about getting connected to the Internet.

children.name: a handy chart for converting pounds into kilos
examples: It’s quite a handy little tool.
It’sveryhandyhaving a light above your desk.
Take your swimming trunks with you – they mightcome in handy(= be useful ).
I always keep old jars – you never know when they mightcome in handy(= be useful ).

children.name: handy for (doing) sth
examples: There’s a special brush you can attach to the vacuum cleaner, which is handy for cleaning the stairs.

children.name: be good for
children.definition: (doing) sth especially spoken to be suitable and useful for a particular job or purpose: có ích để làm cái gì đó
examples: The table does take up a lot of space, but it’s good for parties.
The big jars are good for storing pasta.

children.name: of use
children.definition: formal to be useful: có ích
examples: If there are items in the newspaper files which could be of use, please take a copy of them.
I hope you’ll find the book of use. |
be of use to
This book will be of use to all teachers.
be some/any use
Would these computer cleaners be any use to you?
be of some usebe fairly useful
The information is slightly out-of-date, but it could still be of some use.

children.name: helpful
children.definition: sth that is helpful is useful because it helps you to do sth: giúp ích
examples: Thank you for your advice; it’s been very helpful.

children.name: helpful advice/hints/suggestions etc
examples: Our sales staff are there to give you helpful advice.

children.name: helpful in doing sth
examples: The drug Prozac can be helpful in treating anxiety.

children.name: it is helpful (for sb) to do sth
examples: I think it would be helpful to summarize what we agreed at the last meeting.
It is helpful to discuss your problems with your friends.
It is helpful for family members to gain a basic understanding of the illness.
It is helpful ifwe address a few key questions here.

children.name: be worth sth
children.definition: be worth it use this to say that something you do has a useful result: đáng
examples: I didn’t bother looking at the instructions -- I didn’t think it was worth it.

children.name: be worth doing/trying etcused especially to suggest doing something
examples: It may be worth putting an advertisement in the local paper.

children.name: worthwhile
children.definition: if sth is worthwhile, it is useful for you and you benefit from doing it: đáng giá
examples: He wanted to do a worthwhile job.
We decided to give the money to aworthwhile cause(= one that helps people ).

children.name: it is worthwhile to do sth
examples: I thought it was worthwhile to clarify the matter.

children.name: it is worthwhile doing sth
examples: It wasn’t worthwhile continuing with the project.

children.name: be worth your while
children.definition: be worthyourwhileto be an activity or action that you will get an advantage from
examples: It's worth your while taking out travel insurance before you travel.

children.name: come in useful
children.definition: come in handyinformal/UK informal  sth that comes in handy is not always necessary, but is good to have because it can be very useful in particular situations: phát huy tác dụng
examples: My knowledge of Spanish came in handy when the car broke down near Madrid.
Sometimes there are problems that are too big for you to sort out on your own. That’s when professional advice comes in useful.

children.name: come in handy for (doing) sth
examples: A hacksaw always comes in handy for cutting plastic pipes.

children.name: come in handy as
examples: I suppose you thought I might come in useful as a translator.

children.name: have its uses U
children.definition: have its uses informal use this to say that sth is more useful than it seems: hóa ra rất hữu dụng
examples: This typewriter may be old, but it has its uses.
A knowledge of Latin can have its uses -- for instance, it can help you if you are learning Italian.

children.name: usefulness
children.definition: the state of being useful or the degree to which sth is useful
examples: Statistics have some usefulness in the study of public health issues.

children.name: usefulness of
examples: There are doubts as to the usefulness of this approach(= it may not be useful ).

children.name: outlive its usefulnessnot be useful any more : hết tác dụng
examples: We are beginning to think that this factory has outlived its usefulness as our main supplier.

children.name: As a commuter service, the ferry has outlived its usefulness
utility
children.definition: formal the quality of being useful, or the degree to which something is useful: ích lợi
examples: Demonstrations allow customers to get an immediate idea of a product’s utility.
I have severe doubts about the utility of examinations on subjects which have been learned parrot-fashion.

children.name: when sth helps sb to do sth
aid
children.definition: formal to help sb or sth achieve sth, by making the situation that they are in easier: hỗ trợ
examples: The new government grants are intended to aid small businesses.
Our ability to combat organized crime has been aided by our partnership with local police.

children.name: aid in
examples: The new equipment has been provided to aid in the diagnosis of liver disorders.

children.name: help
children.definition: to make it easier for sb to do sth or to make a difficult situation easier: giúp ích
examples: I took a couple of aspirin for my headache, but they didn’t help.
The warm weather this spring has certainly helped the farmers.

children.name: help sb do sth
examples: All this arguing isn’t going to help us win the election.

children.name: help sb to do sth
examples: The latest report should help us to evaluate the true benefits of the program.

children.name: assist
children.definition: formal to help sb do sth:
examples: They have developed a computerized system that will greatly assist all library users.
They had no maps to assist them.

children.name: assist sb in/with sth
examples: The guide is written to assist consumers in choosing the best insurance plan.
RegisterIn everyday English, people usually sayhelprather thanassist:
We’llhelpin any way we can.
They have special software tohelpthem process invoices.

children.name: be a help
children.definition: if sth is a help, it makes it easier for you to do sth, especially sth that would be difficult to do without it:
examples: For the teachers, just having more books and equipment would be a help.

children.name: be a big/great/real help
examples: Stating your objectives clearly will be a great help in organizing the research.

children.name: beneficial
children.definition: actions, experiences, changes etc that are beneficial help to improve someone’s situation or give them an advantage: có ích, có lợi, lợi ích

children.name: an arrangement that ismutually beneficial(= it has advantages for everyone who is involved )
examples: The relationship between the two companies has been mutually beneficial.

children.name: beneficial to
examples: Recent studies show that moderate amounts of alcohol are beneficial to health.

children.name: beneficial effect/impact/result
examples: There is no evidence that the diet pills have any beneficial effect on weight loss.

children.name: be a boon
children.definition: sth that is a boon happens or is given to you, especially unexpectedly, and makes it much easier for you to do sth: mối lợi
examples: Having a bicycle was a tremendous boon as our house was so far from the village.

children.name: be a boon to/for
examples: The current low exchange rates are a boon for exporters.
Increased competition among airlines will prove to be a boon to tourists.

children.name: with the aid of
children.definition: if you do sth with the aid of sth, especially an object, you need that thing to help you do it: với sự trợ giúp của
examples: The bacteria can only be seen with the aid of a high power microscope.
Since the accident he’s only been able to walk with the aid of a cane.

children.name: invaluable
children.definition: extremely useful in helping you do something : vô giá
examples: His help was invaluable.
an invaluable experience
invaluable to/for
Your advice has been invaluable to us.
invaluable in/for (doing) sth
This help was invaluable in focussing my ideas.
The internet is an invaluable source of information.
The drug could be invaluable for treating cancer patients.

children.name: valuable
children.definition: help, advice, knowledge etc that is valuable is very useful in helping you do sth: quý giá, giá trị
examples: Joyce gave us a lot of valuable advice when we first started the company
valuable to
Your knowledge and experience would be very valuable to us.
it is valuable for sb to do sth
While it is valuable for children to have individual responsibilities, it is also good to share jobs with them.

children.name: help
examples: There can be no doubt that this sort of help is valuable for teachers.

children.name: advice
examples: The booklet contains valuable advice for new mothers.

children.name: information
examples: The police were contacted by a number of people who had valuable information about the bombings.

children.name: experience
examples: The experience you can gain in a small advertising agency will be very valuable.

children.name: contribution
examples: He made a valuable contribution to our work.

children.name: asset
examples: If you have a good network of contacts, you have a valuable asset.

children.name: source
examples: Fish are a valuable source of protein.

children.name: tool
examples: Exercise is a valuable tool in treating depression.

children.name: prove valuable
children.definition: be valuable for someone
examples: This advice was to prove valuable.

children.name: great for
children.definition: be  sthinformalto be very useful for doing something :
examples: The bag is great for taking on holiday.

children.name: asset
children.definition: sth or sb that is useful because they help you succeed or deal with problemsOPP liability: “tài sản”
examples: A sense of humor is a great asset in this business.

children.name: be an asset to sb/sth
examples: I think Rachel would be an asset to the department.

children.name: constructive
children.definition: if advice, criticism or actions are constructive, they are useful and intended to help or improve sth:có tính xây dựng
examples: She criticised my writing, but in a way that was very constructive - I learned a lot from her.
If you don't have anything constructive to say, I'd rather you kept quiet.

children.name: functional
children.definition: designed to be useful rather than beautiful or attractiveOPP decorative:thiết thực; thực dụng
examples: buildings that are sensitively designed, notpurely functional
functional clothing

children.name: productive
children.definition: having positive resultshữu ích
examples: We had a very productive meeting - I felt we sorted out a lot of problems.
Theirs was a very productive partnership.

children.name: unproductive
children.definition: not having positive results:
examples: It was such an unproductive meeting - we achieved hardly anything.

children.name: profitable
children.definition: adjectivecó lợi, có ích; thuận lợisinh lãi, mang lợi

children.name: resulting in or likely to result in a profit or an advantage
examples: Over the years it has developed into a highly profitable business.

children.name: I made profitable use of my time (= used my time to get advantages or benefits) , mixing
examples: with a lot of different people and practising my Spanish.

children.name: in your favour
children.definition: inyourfavour

children.name: When something is in your favour, it gives you an advantage
examples: This candidate has a lot in her favour, especially her experience of teaching.
